pullRequest.body:
* Introduce the `SparseMatrix` structure, which can be used in the Simplex Algorithm via class `UsableInSimplexAlgorithm`.
* Use them in a default `linarith`'s oracle.

This should speed up `linarith` on sparse states. In particular, this affects `nlinarith`, because it typically passes very sparse matrices to the algorithm. 

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #13535

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/5e2395da-f558-4ec4-9396-01df51589792) for commit bcff7a2b8c653c26c168867c4c620d656723f34b.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/175c53ad-5f17-429f-a85b-be156ecebf39/to/5e2395da-f558-4ec4-9396-01df51589792) against commit 3f9d0818f8e36483c6b7a0e3ca52696171bf05c7:
```diff
  Benchmark                                     Metric         Change
  ===================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.Instances.Sphere   instructions    -6.1%
```
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/1ce7b517-2391-411a-a2ec-15a9c5d5e31c) for commit ae1f4f9b2dac331b230b19009240705bd2337005.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/175c53ad-5f17-429f-a85b-be156ecebf39/to/1ce7b517-2391-411a-a2ec-15a9c5d5e31c) against commit 3f9d0818f8e36483c6b7a0e3ca52696171bf05c7:
```diff
  Benchmark                                     Metric         Change
  ===================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.Instances.Sphere   instructions    -6.7%
```
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/4c01fba7-9bd7-4f01-a34a-f981ca6c503e) for commit 3dc4c91cab43678d0a746c3662395c27c500c7ba.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/175c53ad-5f17-429f-a85b-be156ecebf39/to/4c01fba7-9bd7-4f01-a34a-f981ca6c503e) against commit 3f9d0818f8e36483c6b7a0e3ca52696171bf05c7:
```diff
  Benchmark                                     Metric         Change
  ===================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.Instances.Sphere   instructions    -5.2%
```

Note that #13456 also modifies `Manifolds/Instances/Sphere`, including replacing `nlinarith` by `nlinarith only`: it might be worth testing if this speed-up persists.

That said: I'm very happy about any change speeding up tactics, and even after my PR, the `nlinarith` calls are still really slow (half a second each) - so I wouldn't mind a speed-up at all!

Looking at this PR: is there any way to split this up into several pieces? (Reviewing time is very much super-linear in the PR size; I would like this to land sooner than later :-)) For instance, one PR for just the refactoring and another for adding/using sparse matrices?
I'm sorry, committed by accident. I will figure out how to split this PR soon.

### PR summary [9acc88adff](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12819/commits/9acc88adff7b23cfcd77d1bbec9248b99e489bbb)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ CertificateOracle.simplexAlgorithmDense`
`+ CertificateOracle.simplexAlgorithmSparse`
`+ DenseMatrix`
`+ SparseMatrix`
`+ instance : UsableInSimplexAlgorithm DenseMatrix`
`+ instance : UsableInSimplexAlgorithm SparseMatrix`
`- CertificateOracle.simplexAlgorithm`
`- Matrix`
`- instance : UsableInSimplexAlgorithm Matrix`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/8756774e-f28f-4b02-930d-e6a9f01256fc) for commit a308bdb502f2e9a5ceba3f4b39994941e4debfd1.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/75a9085d-70cf-4788-ad75-c804d0610373/to/8756774e-f28f-4b02-930d-e6a9f01256fc) against commit cc768630e3118d913d6557cd549548fefd510160:
```diff
  Benchmark                                     Metric         Change
  ===================================================================
- build                                         linting          5.1%
+ ~Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.Instances.Sphere   instructions    -5.9%
```

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#13535~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/e36ba39c-c618-4059-ab68-6f6765a5c7e8) for commit 9c1215817ab20c2281137832e57261566fb1ff31.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/fc5aafde-c8c0-429f-9472-443204ca2c5b/to/e36ba39c-c618-4059-ab68-6f6765a5c7e8) against commit e16925c9357084ffff5de2715602e513ea01b518.

This should probably be a separate PR, but we need to change how the default oracle is selected. (This was never a concern until your simplex implementation -- the only alternative to FM was a demo using Mathematica!) The linarith config object contains `none` by default and `simplexAlgorithmSparse` is chosen inline in a function in `Verification.lean:206`.
Similarly, the module doc in `Frontend.lean` needs to be updated: it focuses too heavily on FM now and the file structure section is wrong. But this can also be a different PR.

> Similarly, the module doc in `Frontend.lean` needs to be updated: it focuses too heavily on FM now and the file structure section is wrong. But this can also be a different PR.

I am planning to do it in the next PR.
Do you have further updates you want to make to this PR, or do you think it's ready to merge?
I think it is ready now.

Great! Let's merge, with plans to return to (1) optimizing Gaussian elimination and (2) cleaning up doc strings across the `Linarith` directory. Thanks again for the contribution.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9500453564/job/26183545863)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9500453564/job/26183545542)
Indeed, on this example FM seems to outperform dense simplex which outperforms spare simplex. Something feels suspicious here.

I've pushed some improvements. The results I see using `set_option trace.profiler true` aren't consistent, but the sparse simplex is always a bit faster than FM on my machine (2.33s vs. 2.55s). I've measured the time spent by the oracles specifically: the sparse simplex took 79ms (57ms on Gauss Elimination and 15ms on the Simplex Algorithm), while the FM oracle took 110ms.

Actually, I don't understand why Gauss Elimination (and the oracle in general) is so slow. I am new to programming in Lean and don't know how fast it should be. In C, the GE method would take less than 1ms on a matrix of this size (100x100).

This is strange. I'm also seeing somewhat inconsistent timing, but even with your new changes the order is pretty consistently 
> FM seems to outperform dense simplex which outperforms spare simplex

Even weirder: explicitly providing `simplexAlgorithmSparse` as the oracle seems to be 100ms faster than letting it be found as the default (~750ms vs 850ms on my laptop)! I have no idea why.

One of the main drawbacks of FM is that it becomes extremely slow on large states. The following takes more than a minute:
```lean
example (a1 a2 a3 b1 b2 b3 c1 c2 c3 d1 d2 d3 : â„•)
    (h1 : a1 + a2 + a3 = b1 + b2 + b3)
    (h2 : c1 + c2 + c3 = d1 + d2 + d3) :
    a1 * c1 + a2 * c1 + a3 * c1 + a1 * c2 + a2 * c2 + a3 * c2 + a1 * c3 + a2 * c3 + a3 * c3 =
    b1 * d1 + b2 * d1 + b3 * d1 + b1 * d2 + b2 * d2 + b3 * d2 + b1 * d3 + b2 * d3 + b3 * d3 := by
  nlinarith (config := { oracle := some .fourierMotzkin })
```
The sparse simplex method takes only 6 seconds (still longer than it should, but anyway).

> Even weirder: explicitly providing `simplexAlgorithmSparse` as the oracle seems to be 100ms faster than letting it be found as the default (~750ms vs 850ms on my laptop)! I have no idea why.

On my machine, I don't experience this. It seems like all of this is highly dependent on the hardware.

Oh, yes, the simplex oracle is definitely much faster than FM on large states.

It seems like some of my weird timing measurements were artifacts of my testing setup. Sorry for the noise. I'm now seeing the same behavior you are, sparse simplex is about 10% faster than FM on this example.

I agree with you that I'd expect the GE step to be faster. These things are notoriously tricky to get right in a functional language. Since this is already an improvement, I'm willing to take this PR as-is and deal with speeding up the implementation in future work!
Could you add the large state example (the one for which FM takes over a minute) to the test file, with a comment that it's too big for FM but accessible to simplex?

> Could you add the large state example (the one for which FM takes over a minute) to the test file, with a comment that it's too big for FM but accessible to simplex?

Done :)
